column5: For those who wish to take care of their batteries, P/A has the CTEK battery maintainers coming on a decent sale starting tuesday, 2 models.
My battery maintenance starts and finishes with me plugging in my onboard charger, lol.   So much nice then hauling those things out of the boat.

My battery maintenance starts and finishes with me plugging in my onboard charger, lol.   So much nice then hauling those things out of the boat. Bill, Do you leave the batteries on the charger all winter ? Is this okay for the batteries ?

Bill, Do you leave the batteries on the charger all winter ? Is this okay for the batteries ?  Yup, all winter.  Once charged my Guest onboard charger goes into maintenance mode and will trickle charge them when needed.
I find it best to just use the boat on a biweekly basis during the winter months. Saves on fuel stabilizer and such.
I find it best to just use the boat on a biweekly basis during the winter months. Saves on fuel stabilizer and such. What do you use it for...blowing snow with a big big prop...

What do you use it for...blowing snow with a big big prop... LOL  There is always open water somewhere in Ontario. Last year, we hit the Niagara on a regular basis if we weren't on Simcoe ice fishing.
